TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ProjectInstance extends System.Object

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Diagnostics.DebuggerDisplay("{FullPath} #Targets={TargetsCount} DefaultTargets={(DefaultTargets == null) ? System.String.Empty : System.String.Join(";", DefaultTargets.ToArray())} ToolsVersion={Toolset.ToolsVersion} InitialTargets={(InitialTargets == null) ? System.String.Empty : System.String.Join(";", InitialTargets.ToArray())} #GlobalProperties={globalProperties.Count} #Properties={properties.Count} #ItemTypes={items.ItemTypes.Count} #Items={items.Count}")

Docs.summary: Represents a project instance.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Instances of this class result when a project is cloned. Constructors are internal in order to require users to create project instances from existing projects.
New project instances are immutable, except that instance items can be added to them and instance properties set on them. Project instances are useful because they can be modified and built several times without disturbing the original project.
Neither this class nor any of its constituents is allowed to have references to <xref:Microsoft.Build.Construction> or <xref:Microsoft.Build.Evaluation> objects.
Project instance targets, host services, and the task registry are not exposed.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class Microsoft.Build.Construction.ProjectRootElement xml) cil managed

Docs.param: The project root element.
Docs.summary: Creates a new project instance and initializes it from the given project root, using the default project collection.

remarks.format: ## Remarks No intermediate <xref:Microsoft.Build.Evaluation.Project> object is created. This is useful if a project is going to be built, but not displayed or edited.

Docs.returns: Returns true if the build succeeds; false otherwise.

Docs.summary: Builds the default targets of the project with the given loggers.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Throws InvalidOperationException if any of the loggers supplied are already attached to the logging service.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class Microsoft.Build.Execution.ProjectInstance DeepCopy() cil managed

Docs.summary: Creates an independent, deep clone of this project and everything in it. Clone has the same mutability as the original. Useful for compiling a single file or for keeping build results between builds.
Docs.returns: Creates an independent, deep clone of this project.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class Microsoft.Build.Execution.ProjectInstance DeepCopy(bool isImmutable) cil managed

Docs.param: Flag indicating clone mutability.
Docs.summary: Creates an independent, deep clone of this project and everything in it, with specified mutability. Useful for compiling a single file or for keeping build results between builds.
Docs.returns: Returns an independent, deep clone of this project, with specified mutability.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the list of default targets for this project.
Docs.value: Returns the list of default targets for this project.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Default targets are built if no targets are explicitly specified.

Docs.summary: Gets the project root directory. Used for evaluation of relative paths and setting the current directory during build. Is never null: projects not loaded from disk use the current directory from the time the build started.
Docs.value: Returns the project root directory, which is never null. Projects not loaded from disk return the current directory at the time the build was started.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool EvaluateCondition(string condition) cil managed

Docs.param: The string to be expanded.
Docs.summary: Evaluates the provided string as a condition by expanding items and properties, using the current items and properties available, then doing a logical evaluation.
Docs.returns: Returns true if the string evaluates to true; false otherwise.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This is useful for the immediate window.
Does not expand bare metadata expressions.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance string ExpandString(string unexpandedValue) cil managed

Docs.param: The string to be expanded.
Docs.summary: Evaluates the provided string by expanding items and properties, using the current items and properties available.
Docs.returns: Returns the expanded string value.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This is useful for some hosts, or for the debugger immediate window.
Does not expand bare metadata expressions.

Docs.summary: Gets the full path to the project file. Used for logging.
Docs.value: Returns the full path to the project file. Returns null if the project was never named.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Microsoft.Build.Execution.ProjectPropertyInstance GetProperty(string name) cil managed

Docs.param: The name of the property to retrieve.
Docs.summary: Get the property with the given name.
Docs.returns: Returns the property with the given name. Returns null if no property exists with that name.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance string GetPropertyValue(string name) cil managed

Docs.param: The name of the property whose value is to be retrieved.
Docs.summary: Get the value of the property with the given name.
Docs.returns: Returns the value of the property with the given name. Returns an empty string if no property exists with that name. The value returned has no escaped character sequences.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method does not distinguish between a property with a value of empty string and no property with the given name.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig string GetPropertyValueEscaped(class Microsoft.Build.Execution.ProjectPropertyInstance property) cil managed

Docs.param: The property to be escaped.
Docs.summary: Get the escaped value of the provided property.
Docs.returns: Returns the escaped value of the provided property.

Docs.summary: Gets the dictionary of global properties this project was evaluated with, if any.
Docs.value: Returns the dictionary of global properties this project was evaluated with.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Read only collection.
Traverses project references.
This is the publicly exposed getter, that translates into a read-only dead IDictionary\<string, string>.

Docs.summary: Gets the list of initial targets for the project and all its imports, depth-first. These targets are built before any other targets.
Docs.value: Returns the list of initial targets for the project and all its imports, depth-first.

Docs.summary: Gets a flag indicating that the project instance is immutable. This flag is set permanently when the instance is created.
Gets a read-only dictionary of the item definitions in the project, keyed by item type.
Docs.value: Returns a read-only dictionary of the item definitions in the project, keyed by item type.

Docs.summary: Gets all items in this project.
Docs.value: Returns all items in this project.

Docs.summary: Gets all item types in this project.
Docs.value: Returns all item types in this project.

Docs.summary: Gets the location of the originating file itself. Never null.
Docs.value: Returns the location of the originating file. Never returns null.

Docs.summary: Gets all properties in this project.
Docs.value: Returns all properties in this project.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool RemoveItem(class Microsoft.Build.Execution.ProjectItemInstance item) cil managed

Docs.param: The item to be removed.
Docs.summary: Removes an item from the project, if present. Returns true if it was present, false otherwise.
Docs.returns: Returns true if the item was present before removal; false otherwise.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool RemoveProperty(string name) cil managed

Docs.param: The name of the property to be removed.
Docs.summary: Removes a property with the given name. Returns true if the property had a value (possibly empty string), otherwise false.
Docs.returns: Returns true if the property had a value (possibly an empty string) before removal; false otherwise.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class Microsoft.Build.Execution.ProjectPropertyInstance SetProperty(string name, string evaluatedValue) cil managed

Docs.param: The name of the property to add.
The evaluated value of the property to add.
Docs.summary: Add a property with the specified name and value to the project. Overwrites any property with the same name already in the property collection.
Docs.returns: Returns the new property.

remarks.format: ## Remarks We don't take a ProjectPropertyInstance to make sure we don't have one that's already in use by another ProjectPropertyInstance.

Docs.summary: Gets an enumerator over all targets in this project. This collection is read-only.
Docs.value: Returns an enumerator over all targets in this project.

Docs.summary: Gets the tools version this project was evaluated with, if any.
Docs.value: Returns the tools version this project was evaluated with, if any.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The result is not necessarily the same as the tools version on the Project tag, if any; it may have been externally specified, for example with a /tv switch.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class Microsoft.Build.Construction.ProjectRootElement ToProjectRootElement() cil managed

Docs.summary: Creates a ProjectRootElement from the contents of this ProjectInstance.
Docs.returns: Returns a ProjectRootElement which represents this instance.

Docs.summary: Replaces the project state <xref:Microsoft.Build.Execution.ProjectInstance.GlobalProperties%2A>, <xref:Microsoft.Build.Execution.ProjectInstance.Properties%2A> and <xref:Microsoft.Build.Execution.ProjectInstance.Items%2A> with those from the specified .
